description: 15-min merged recording of ~11 pre-recorded standalone hooks/tips recorded back-to-back in a single session. Multiple retakes per topic. Tests contiguous_batch detection: the LLM must NOT use cold opens, must detect retakes, pick the cleanest take per topic, and output one contiguous segment per topic. Key failure modes: (1) missing the trust gap hook at 59s, (2) picking stumble takes, (3) Frankenstein editing across topics.

ground_truth.summary: Trust gap hook — the gap between awareness and purchase intent
ground_truth.rationale: Standalone hook at the very start of the recording. Short but punchy. Models frequently miss this because they skip the first ~80s of the transcript.

ground_truth.summary: AI ethics — just because we can doesn't mean we should
ground_truth.rationale: 5 takes of the same hook (at 83s, 98s, 117s, 126s, 133s). Take at 98s is cleanest complete thought. Take at 133s has a stumble ('doing asking'). Take at 126s is also clean but shorter. The LLM must reject the stumble take.

ground_truth.summary: 500 UGC videos in 10 minutes — but should you?
ground_truth.rationale: Two takes (146s incomplete, 151s complete with 'but should you' payoff). Best take: 151s.

ground_truth.summary: Think like a producer, not a consumer
ground_truth.rationale: Single clean take. Standalone marketing habit tip.

ground_truth.summary: Human in the loop — why we reject full automation + marketing has a soul
ground_truth.rationale: Multiple takes for two related hooks: automation limits (191s, 203s, 211s) and soul of marketing (221s, 227s, 229s). Best automation take: 211s. Best soul take: 229s. They're the same broader topic (human touch in marketing). Acceptable to split into two segments.

ground_truth.summary: Problem-centered marketing — stop centering around the product
ground_truth.rationale: Two takes (253s and 275s). Take at 275s is punchier ('come to us for' vs 'are having'). Body content at 294s follows naturally.

ground_truth.summary: Inspect your purchasing behavior — a trick to become a better marketer
ground_truth.rationale: Two takes (340s and 346s). Take at 346s adds 'purchasing' which is more specific and actionable.

ground_truth.summary: Turn sales objections into content + use social media as a client classroom
ground_truth.rationale: Largest topic in the batch. Sales objections hook, pen-and-paper CTA (must include 'call' at 386.88 — common LLM cut error), content payoff, and classroom analogy. All one thematic unit about using client questions for content. Acceptable to split classroom into its own segment.

ground_truth.summary: Quality erodes trust — commit to quality before scaling quantity
ground_truth.rationale: Full quality discussion: aggressive hook, empathetic body ('I know you're busy'), quality vs quantity choice, and CTA. Common failure mode: LLM splits hook and payoff into separate segments.

ground_truth.summary: Social presence — clients stalk you online + keep posting consistently
ground_truth.rationale: Two related sub-topics: ghost shopping behavior and consistency message. Same broader theme (importance of ongoing social presence). Acceptable to split into two segments.

ground_truth.summary: Word of mouth isn't enough — real estate agent story proves social presence matters
ground_truth.rationale: Myth-busting hook, challenge question, personal story, payoff, conclusion, and CTA. Longest coherent narrative in the batch.
